body.p: Sometimes the immune system appears to get confused and it starts mount an immune response against the the body's own tissues. What is this referred to as?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Graft-versus-host disease occurs when the white blood cells found in donor tissue attack the transplant recipient.
Incorrect. Lymphedema refers to swelling in a limb or section of the body because the lymph system is not properly draining that tissue.
Incorrect. Lymphoma is a cancerous condition in which the white blood cells are reproducing out of control.

body.p: One of the results of the inflammatory response is accumulation of fluid in the affected area (edema). This happens in response to tissue injury such as a sprained ankle or an infection caused by a splinter in one’s finger. Select the correct statement from the choices below.

input.choice: Activation of the inflammatory response does not indicate a disruption of homeostasis. Presence of extra fluid in the tissues directly activates the innate immune response.
The lymph vessels will eventually drain away the excess fluid. The kinin-kallikrein system causes capillary leakage resulting in edema.
Swelling from tissue injury happens because your body makes excess fluid in that area.
The lymph vessels will bring in the cells from the immune system to fight any potential infection.
Tissue edema does not involve the lymphatic system

feedback.p: Incorrect. The activation of the inflammatory response is an indicator that homeostasis has been disrupted.
Correct. The lymph vessels will eventually drain away the excess fluid.
Incorrect. The body doesn’t make excess tissue fluid it accumulates because of the kinin-kallikrien system stimulates vasodilation and capillary leakage.
Incorrect. The main function of lymph vessels is to drain tissues, not cellular transport.
Incorrect. Resolution of tissue swelling requires a fully functioning lymph system.

body.p: T cells come in several varieties. Cytotoxic T cells are important because they can become activated and kill target cells. Which of the following are not needed directly for Cytotoxic T cell activation?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Cytokines do not play a specific role in the activation of Cytotoxic T cells.
Incorrect. Interferons, are part of a response against viruses.
Incorrect. Complement does not play a part in the way Cytotoxic T cells kills cells.
Incorrect. Antibodies do not play a role here either.
Correct. None of these choices is needed for Cytotoxic T cell activation.
